msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 11
ab.l: And all the people of the earth wasof one language, and of one speech.
And it was, when they journeyedfrom the east, that they found a plain in the lowland of Shinar, andthey dwelt there.
And they said one to another,‘Come, let us make bricks and burn them in fire’.And they had brick for stone, andquicklime for clay.
And they said,‘Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower with its topreaching to skies, and let us make a fame for ourselves, lestwe be dispersed over the face of the whole earth.
Andthe divine Presence of the Lord came down to see the city and the tower,which the children of men built.
And theLord said, ‘Lo, the people are one, and they have all one language, and this isthe beginning of |what| they |will| do. And now nothing will be restrained from them,that they would think to do.
Come, let us go down, and confuse therethe words of their lips that they may not understand one another’s speech.’
So the Lord dispersed them from there over the faceof all the earth, and they left off building the city.
On account of this its name is called Babel, because there the Lord confusedthe language of all the people of the earth, and from there the Lord dispersed themover the face of all the earth.
These are thechildren of Shem: Shem was a hundred years old, and begatArpachshad two years after the flood.
And Shem lived after he had begotten Arpachshadfive hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
And Arpachshad lived thirty-five years, and begatShelah.
And Arpachshad lived after he had begottenShelah four hundred and three years, andbegat sons and daughters.
And Shelah livedthirty years, and begat Eber.
And Shelah livedafter he had begotten Eber four hundredand three years, and begat sons and daughters.
And Eber livedfour and thirty years, and begat Peleg.
And Eber lived after he had begotten Pelegfour hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.
And Peleg lived thirty years, and begatRuʿu.
And Peleg lived after he had begottenRuʿu two hundred and nine years, and begat sonsand daughters.
And Ruʿu lived thirty-two years,and begat Serug.
And Ruʿu livedafter he had begotten Serug two hundredand seven years, and begat sons and daughters.
AndSerug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor.
And Serug lived after he had begottenNahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.
And Nahor lived twenty-nine years, and begatTerah.
And Nahor lived after he had begottenTerah a hundred and nineteen years, andbegat sons and daughters.
And Terah livedseventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, andHaran.
And these are the childrenof Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor,and Haran, and Haran begat Lot.
And Haran died when his father Terah was alive in the land of his kindred,in Ur of the Chaldeans.
AndAbram and Nahor took them wives. The name of Abram’s wife wasSarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife was Milcah, daughter of Haran, fatherof Milcah and father of Iscah.
But Saraiwas barren. She had no child.

And Terah tookAbram, his son, and Lot, son of Haran, his son’s son,and Sarai, his daughter in law, the wife of Abram, his son,and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldeans to go to the landof Canaan. And they came as far as Haran, and they dwelt there.
And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years,and Terah died in Haran.

app.note: K: twenty-nine; a scribal error. | Heb. תְּשַע־עֶשְׂרֵה ‘nineteen’.
